noun.name: pottedplant
noun.discription: a plant grown in a pot or other container, typically indoors or in a garden

object1.name: terrarium
object1.discription: in parallel with 'pottedplant', is a sealed transparent container containing soil and plants, often used to grow small plants and create a miniature ecosystem

object2.name: bonsai
object2.discription: in parallel with 'pottedplant', is a Japanese art form using cultivation techniques to grow small trees in containers, creating the visual beauty of a full-sized tree

object3.name: aquarium
object3.discription: in parallel with 'pottedplant', is a vivarium of any size having at least one transparent side in which water-dwelling plants and animals are kept and displayed

object4.name: cactus
object4.discription: in parallel with 'pottedplant', is a type of plant with thick, fleshy stems and spines, adapted to survive in dry environments

object5.name: fern
object5.discription: in parallel with 'pottedplant', is a vascular plant that reproduces via spores and has no flowers or seeds, often grown as a decorative houseplant

object6.name: orchid
object6.discription: in parallel with 'pottedplant', is a diverse and widespread family of flowering plants with colorful and fragrant blooms, often cultivated for their beauty

object7.name: succulent
object7.discription: in parallel with 'pottedplant', is a plant with parts that are thickened, fleshy, and engorged, usually to retain water in arid climates or soil conditions

object8.name: airplant
object8.discription: in parallel with 'pottedplant', is a type of plant that does not require soil to grow, absorbing moisture and nutrients directly from the air and rain
